name: Hyatt Regency Princeton

reviews.text: we booked through a third party, priceline,at an excellent price. when we arrived we were given a choice of rooms and floors. the room was large and comfortable as was the bed. everything worked. staff at desk were able and pleasant. food in bar was overpriced and poor but too tired to go out. loved hotel except.......................gave them a debit card on check in as already pre paid, they deducted $170 ( a little steep), on check out they deducted my "extras" bill for food and internet($ 90) on that day seperately from original hold and i am still waiting, a week later, for the release of the original $170
reviews.title: stay again hyatt

reviews.text: Not sure what experience the people who said the hotel was dirty or moldy had, but I have stayed at this hotel at least 10 times in the last 2 years and LOVE it. The room service is pricey, but beyond that, wonderful. I was snowed in during the blizzard, and housekeeping gladly shoveled my car out when it was over. I "lost" my car, could not remember where I parked, and the shuttle driver offered to drive me around the lot to find it. I never carried more than one bag without help being offered. The staff is great. Every time I come, they great me - not always by name because my visits are spaced out, but they do say "welcome back" acknowledging I am a return guest.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as part of the Sesame Place package. The room was spacious and clean. It had a balcony that overlooked the restaurant and koi pond. I would recommend. The staff was very helpful. The pool was nice also!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Got room through Priceline @ 52.00 a night total. I felt over charged @ that price let alone the published rates.
reviews.title: No value here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon entry hotel is warm and inviting. Furniture/decore is out dated (looks to be15 yrs old but is in decent shape). Front desk staff was very friendly and seemed genuinely concerned for the comfort of my stay.
reviews.title: Great place to stay while in Princeton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Business oriented hotel with fancy atrium, restaurant, gym (well-equipped), pool, and other facilities. It's in a very convenient location, in a business park. We got a good rate for a family event, stayed 4 nights. A rental car desk in the hotel was convenient. Front desk employees were friendly and tried to be helpful. Did not eat at hotel restaurant, but friends who did said it was way overpriced. Room was comfortable, standard big chain hotel room, very good beds, and quiet (except for the large drunken party that affected the whole hotel one night).
reviews.title: Decent chain hotel with shortcomings

reviews.text: Negatives: They advertise the availability of wireless internet but don't tell you it costs $10/day. That's outrageous, budget chain hotels offer it free or minimal cost.
reviews.title: pretty good

reviews.text: They will also strong-arm you for phone calls: "access fee" for local calls is $1, and forget long distance (after the operator said something about a $7 surcharge I stopped listening; used my cell phone for all calls).
reviews.title: Place is great but the rooms stink!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room maintenance was inconsistent: one day the floor wasn't vacuumed, on arrival one trash can was missing, other days we either had too many towells/washclothes or too few.
reviews.title: Nice stay at an older hotel - would go again
Dissapponting from registration to departure
reviews.text: For a business hotel (it's in a business park), the lack of desktop outlets is surprising (unless you unplug the coffee pot for one). I discovered a power strip, but it was hidden under one of the beds!

We stayed here for three nights in July so we could go to Sesame Place in nearby Langhorne, Pa. The hotel offers a Sesame Place package that includes a free breakfast buffet each morning of your stay and also tickets to Sesame Place. We found the hotel very clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. They have a nice indoor pool for any rainy weather and our kids loved staying here. They loved the Koi Pond at the restaurant every morning. A nice quality hotel and a good value if you get the package deals.
reviews.title: A nice hotel with friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spacious tall atrium was like a garden oasis. After a gracious welcoming, we were asked our choice of terraced rooms overlooking the atrium or outside rooms overlooking the beautiful landscaping. We chose to have a terrace overlooking the atrium and were not disappointed. The room was immaculate, and with the new "Great Bed" the king size was like floating on clouds.
reviews.title: We had our own romantic weekend, while attending a wedding...

reviews.text: The wedding was nothing short of magnificent in the ballroom which we were told was the area's largest.The "look" created was of an angelic paradise of whites and golds. From floral arrangements to very attentive table service, we will long remember this wedding. Our many friends agreed with our appraisal and a great time was had by all.
reviews.title: Would stay at Hyatt again

reviews.text: The breakfast buffet was outstanding one morning- everything you could imagine: oatmeals, cereals, sausage and eggs made your way, fresh fruits, excellent Starbucks coffee, muffins and croissants, breads all freshly baked. The other morning we had breakfast in bed in our room and were delighted that it arrived promptly and that our waiter later called to see if we were satisfied. We were!
reviews.title: What a lovely experience to stay even if it was on business
Big disappointment
reviews.text: Short of tucking us in at night, the staff was very competent and accommodating when asked anything answered with a smile. We were given excellent maps and directions to attractions like discount outlets, the Jersey shore (only 45 minutes away). In addition they were super in telling us how everything works and getting you things that we didn't even think of, like the best exchange rates. Also the room was state-of-the- art wired and we could connect to our email very easily in the room

This is our second time staying here. We booked through the Sesame Place website and the package they offer is a very good deal. Buy 2 nights and the third is free, tickets to park are upgraded to season passes and breakfast is free each morning at hotel restaurant. You get a very good value for your money. The hotel was very clean, from the outside landscaping to the interior of the lobby and the rooms. Pool was never crowded and very well maintained. Restaurant was very clean and the food was quite good. Staff was extremely friendly, Jean Claude in the restaurant was very nice and helpful and our kids really liked him. He even had Elmo come over to our table for the little ones. If you want a nice quiet, clean and friendly hotel to stay at when visiting Sesame Place then this is the hotel to choose.
reviews.title: Second time staying here and I highly recommend.

reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel in 2 months and I gave it the benifit of the doubt last time, however, it is still failing on the same issues as our flight crew mentioned previously. The main single problem is the staffing issue and total lack of management. Service is the most important issue when it comes to a single night stop in a business hotel and due to its skeleton staffing it just can not meet the guest requirements in every single depatment. We waited over an hour at 6pm to check in when they knew a week in advance that a party of 29 were staying. The same to book out the next morning, and as fo the poor over worked bar tender. It is so unfortunate as the rooms are fantastic once you get in them. As for the food, I had to send my meal back twice for the same problem and they still insisted the meal be put on the bill despite my complaints after the 3rd attempt to get a decently cooked meal. As you will see from my previous reviews, I have always been fair in comment, however, i will ensure that our company do not use this hotel in the futre and if a company like Hyatt can turn down a group booking of upto 30 guests every month, then it says a lot of our current financial climate.
reviews.title: Avoid at all costs.

reviews.text: After checking out of a different hotel in the South Princeton area were moved to the Hyatt with our 9 and 11 year old boys and were glad we did. The Hyatt is conveniently located to everything in the Princeton area including the university and to the Princeton Junction train station.
reviews.title: Good location and great rate!

reviews.text: Nothing fancy or glamorous. A generally clean and spacious hotel at an affordable rate. We were glad to move there from a new hotel that was not as conveniently located and was more than 3x's the rate we paid at the Hyatt.
reviews.title: wonderful experience excellent hotel and staff! luxurious setting!

reviews.text: My biggest complaint was the extra charge for internet access.
reviews.title: Buyer Beware! Theft of services!

reviews.text: Other comments are correct. Wireless doesn't work, desk cordless telephone didn't work (asked for replacement, which never came). Front Desk Manager said they're aware that the wireless doesn't work but they're locked into a contract with T-Mobile and can't change it. Hotel is otherwise drab and restaurant is overpriced.
reviews.title: Not business friendly

reviews.text: Unfortunately for me, this hotel is my company's preferred hotel for Princeton, and in my opinion I would prefer something other. I have stayed at this hotel about 10+ times over the last year and a half. This hotel is just basic. It's the difference between regular tap water and perrier..... Its just okay. There are no frills here and really no perks. It’s just a place to lay your head.
reviews.title: I should've had a V8!

likes.liked: — The quick check out is very convienient and helps me to make a quick getaway!

reviews.text: The good: There is a hotel shuttle to take you to the airport. A hertz stand in the hotel for pick ups and drop offs. The alarm clock has an iPod docking station. (Just don't forget it when you check out) The bed is ultra comfy... I have slept through many-a wake up calls because of it. The business center is phenomenal. Imagine Kinko’s, but in a hotel. The room service is yummilicious. Try the matzo ball soup or avocado & tomato salad!
reviews.title: Overpriced. Better options in Princeton.

likes.liked: — Parking was free, Front Desk and Catering staff were very helpful
likes.disliked: — Price was ridiculous, Average rooms, Hyatt Concierge online.

reviews.text: The bad: The service is average; however never have a package delivered it because their mail system for guests is disorganized. The breakfast buffet is fabu, however it was cost you. The bathrooms need to be remodeled, they are very hospital like.
reviews.title: Just OK for a Hyatt

reviews.text: The ugly: The rooms are bland. The TV is outdated and oddly placed so if you are working at the desk, you will have to have a head like an owl in order to see it. The T-mobile wireless signal is very weak. For a business traveler, you will find open outlets to be a challenge.
reviews.title: Quite an expensive place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hyatt Regency Princeton offers you a basic room with adequate customer service. The room was spacious and clean; however the interior design was grossly outdated compared to other Hyatt Regencys. The bed was hard as a rock, but the pillows (wow do they give you a ton of pillows) were quite comfortable. There was no sitting chair and the tv was in an odd location making it uncomfortable to view from the bed. The bathrooms were dimly lit and felt like a roadside motel bathroom or hospital. The common areas of the hotel were well kept and the ammenities were decent. All in all a step up from a Comfort Inn and not nearly up to snuff with other Hyatt Hotels.
reviews.title: Basic Accomodations

reviews.text: So, I stayed at this hotel for one night, and I have to say that if you like a "regular" Hyatt experience, this isn't the place for you.
reviews.title: Very disappointing

reviews.text: Let me start out by saying that I'm a Hyatt Platinum member, so I have some loyalty to the brand.
reviews.title: Okay but has problems

reviews.text: When I checked in, I was informed that there was no Regency Club at this property. I found that odd.
reviews.title: Customer service supreme!

reviews.text: There are a bunch of things that don't jive with the website:
reviews.title: Not so hot

reviews.text: The Hyatt was the first of four hotels I stayed at in Princeton in one week. I like to change hotels when I travel. Since it was a Hyatt Regency I expected it to be a very nice stay, and it was not as nice as I'd hoped.
reviews.title: Disappointed for a Hyatt but not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has a large (huge) parking lot between it and Rt. 1, so is set back from the highway. It is one of those where some of the rooms look outside and the ones on the other side of the hall lookout over the hotel interior. I had an external room which was quiet: I did not hear any traffic noise. The machinery in the room was quiet and the cycling of the heating system did not bother me, as it did in other hotels I stayed at during the trip. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was very very large but mostly wasted space. I found the shower awkwardly designed. The controls for the shower are hard to reach from outside the shower: they are at least 18 inches from where you are if you are outside the shower, so you have to reach around to turn it on or be in the tub to do so. The tub basin has a very thick (eight inches or so) relatively high edge that you need to climb over to enter the shower, and there is a sloping part of the floor on the end opposite the side where the control are that I almost slipped in trying to get into the tub. A really terrible design flaw.
reviews.title: A charge for internet? outrageous!

reviews.text: Service when it was available was great. The check-in clerks and check-out clerks were friendly and knowledgeable about the local area. Room service and service at the breakfast restaurant were top notch. But there was a surprisingly awful service lapse too: The only reason I had room service was that I could not find anyone to seat me in the dinner restaurant at 6:30 PM on a Sunday! I both waited at the place where you usually are greeted, and then even wandered around the restaurant looking for a staffer, and then decided that if it took that long to get seated, the service might be dreadful.
reviews.title: Very Efficient

reviews.text: The breakfast service was much better and gracious. They had a buffet available and a full service menu. I ate from the buffet. The hot food was fine, but the fruit (the usual cut melon, etc) was dried out and worse, there were tiny little flies flying around it. The waiter offered to get me fruit from the kitchen (and he was clearly unhappy about the flies) but it was offputting!
reviews.title: A little long in the tooth

reviews.text: The fitness center has about five cardio machines and a few pairs of dumbbells up to about 25 pounds. I did not use the pool.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised

reviews.text: This was part of a very well priced package through Sesame Place. The 3 night hotel/park package saved us about $500 so no complaints there.
reviews.title: Good deal through Sesame Place Package; thankfully.

reviews.text: Pro: Breakfast buffet was included through package
reviews.title: So glad we didn't pay full price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Con: Thankfully; because the buffet breakfast for 2 adults and 2 small children was priced at $70...but I wrote it was included in package on bill/receipt & it was credited
reviews.title: Very average and rooms in need of updating

reviews.text: Pro: Pool was excellent...clean...never crowded...open for extensive hours
reviews.title: Nice, not fancy.

reviews.text: Pro: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful
reviews.title: Pretty good hotel, would stay here again

description: Located in the heart of Princeton's Carnegie Center, the Hyatt Regency Princeton is minutes away from Princeton University, historic sites, upscale shops and AMTRAK/NJ train station with service to New York and Philadelphia.
